summary: The Flower Shop Around The Corner (I)
title: The Flower Shop Around The Corner (I)
body:
Part 1 : The Wallet

 Here we go… I have sinned again and started yet another series when I have so many things to do…

Oops…

Hope you like it!

And yes, I am also sinning again because I’m writing for another actor… Oops again.

Gif not mine

Word count: 2128


New York in bloom was a fair sight to see. The streets were filled with merry strangers mingling with the always-hurrying workers. Unknown faces that kept on moving all around, in one direction or the other. And in the centre of the busy city, Central Park was an oasis lost in a desert.

Central Park was filled with laziness and sunshine. Children played while their parents relaxed under the shadow of the trees. And through the park, the flowers coloured the alleys and filled the air with sugary fragrances.

Everything felt sunny and happy to you. But perhaps it was also the prospect of starting a new job that made you this merry.

A three months job was awaiting you here in New York. The creation of a new movie was always exciting to you. It meant that you would bring a brand-new character to life. After all, it was the advantage of becoming an actress.

You would start this new job the next day, and you had to admit that your excitement was tainted with apprehension. It was always a strange mix of fear and excitement, to start a new adventure. And because this next movie was a love story, you were even more nervous than usual. After all, if you couldn’t get along with the actor playing your love interest, everything would be harder.

You counted on Chris Evans’s professionalism in any case. After all, he was talented and had a good reputation amongst actors. Everything would surely be just fine.

You crossed the street from the edge of the park to the busy sidewalks that ran against the skyscrapers. An old man was selling hot dogs, when a few meters away, you could buy today’s newspapers. There was a strange excitation all around you, a dance of shorts and dresses and briefcases and suits. A mix of holidays and busy workers. But most of all, it felt like New York. There was no other word to describe the peculiar atmosphere.

You had spotted from afar a little flower shop at the corner of the street, on the right side of the park. And with such a sun shining in the sky, you couldn’t refrain the urge to buy a bouquet for your apartment. Or well, your cousin’s apartment, actually. Edgar had accepted with a grin to welcome you in his flat for the three months you were to work in the busy city. You were thus living now with him… and almost with his boyfriend too, as Sebastian spent more time there than in his own flat.

And you reckoned that nor Edgar nor Seb would mind if you bought a few bright flowers.

You headed there with a content smile on your face, humming softly a song to yourself, your voice covered by the sounds of the street.

Cars honked a few meters away as you reached the door of the shop. Flowers were also sprayed outside, the bouquets narrowing the sidewalk, and you spent a few minutes admiring the plants. You smelled some of them, from gerberas to daisies and roses. Red, yellow, white, pink, orange… so many colours that widened the smile on your lips.

You chose a few gerberas and finally walked inside the shop, discovering flowers and plants everywhere, filling the room, resting on many shelves… so many that the stone walls were barely visible under so many petals and leaves.

You were admiring a red hibiscus when you spotted on the wooden floor what looked like a piece of leather. You picked it up and recognized the object as a wallet. Puzzled, you brought it to one of the employees, a tall woman with red hair whose name was pinned on her apron as Carlotta.

“Oh… dear! The poor man!” she exclaimed, looking around the shop, but there was no other client than you inside. “Well, give it to me, dear. I’ll make sure he gets it. Have you chosen some flowers? Oh, now… what a good choice! Gerberas are such happy flowers, I’ll make you a bouquet!”

As you walked out of the shop, you took a deep breath into the sweet scent of your flowers, closing your eyes to engrave the fragrance in your lungs, trying to remember it.

When you opened your eyes again, you let your gaze drift across the crowd… A woman pushing a stroller, a couple holding hands, a man running with his dog next to him and finally waiting at a traffic light…

Why would someone be rushing today?

After all, it was such a lovely day…

——————————————————————

These past couple of days had been hell.

Chris was near panicked. His stay at New York started beautifully…

He had missed his train to come from Boston, had almost killed a cat with a dishwasher (that adventure was probably the worst) and now he had lost his wallet.

Beautiful start indeed…

He was now running through the streets of New York, Dodger’s leash tightly held in his hand. And he found that the weather was way too hot for that…

Waiting for the lights to turn green at a crossroad, he took off his Patriots cap to dry his sweaty brow. By his side, Dodger seemed to have a good time running around the streets.

At least one of them had a good time…

His heart was beating fast, but Chris wasn’t sure if it was because of his running or because of the fear that made a lump creep up his throat.

He searched again for this flower shop he had stopped by a few hours before.

Where was that damn shop…? He remembered it was around there, but his brain seemed too numbed by stress and nerves to work properly.

By his side, Dodger barked a couple of times as the traffic light turned green and people started to hurry forward. As he crossed the road, he finally spotted the bright flowers in the distance.

He didn’t slow down his pace before he had reached the welcoming shop, and he did nothing less than run inside.

He hurried to Carlotta, who stood behind the counter, and he had to lean against the wooden surface as he caught his breath.

“Oh, hello again! I recognize you, you were here this morning already! Have you changed your mind and want to buy something?” Carlotta asked with a bright smile.

But Chris shook his head.

“I’ve lost my wallet this morning, so I’m tracing back my steps,” he explained, heaving a sigh to try to slow down his racing heart, his voice cut by his shallow breathing. “You wouldn’t have found it, by any chance?”

“Oh! But of course! You’re a lucky man! This lovely woman just found one near the hibiscus over there. Hang on, I’ll check the ID inside to see if it’s yours.”

“Oh, yes, please do,” Chris begged, leaning over the wooden counter while the florist walked in her office.

He rested his cheek against the cool surface, closing his tired eyes, breathing deeply to fill his lungs with as much air as he could, before letting it all out again. Slowly, he caught his breath and felt his heart reach a regular rhythm once more. He didn’t look up before Carlotta was back with the wallet, and he let out a grunt as he forced himself to stand straighter again.

He recognized his belonging in the blink of an eye, and he heaved a relieved sigh.

“Thank god…”

“It is yours indeed! You really are lucky, I hadn’t spotted it at all. It’s a client who did, and… oh actually you could have bumped into each other, she exited the shop a minute before you rushed in!”

“After such a fright, I’m glad it ended that way!” he grinned, resting a hand on his heart. “Actually… now that I’ve found my wallet back, I think I’ll buy these flowers I saw outside.”

“The peonies? That’s a very good choice, they’re particularly beautiful this year!”

Carlotta hurried outside to fetch some pink peonies, the shade pale and as delicate as the petals themselves. Meanwhile, Chris was petting Dodger with a bright laugh.

“Ends well, buddy! I didn’t think so at first!”

The dog merely swayed his tail and barked a couple of times in response, as if seeing Chris smiling was enough to make the pet understand that the day was not so bad after all.

As the florist came back with the flowers, she kept the conversation going.

“Such a lovely lady, it was… and an honest one! These days, many would have taken the money before handing over the rest.”

“Well, if she comes back, please, thank her for me.”

He paid for the flowers and turned around to leave, but he stopped dead in his tracks before even taking a step towards the door.

Dodger was already trotting towards the exit, pulling on his leash but Chris wasn’t moving. Instead, he spun back around towards Carlotta.

“Actually… if she comes back… would you mind giving her a note? I’d like to thank her myself and… give her a peony for me. I’ll buy you one more.”

Carlotta heaved a dreamy sigh.

“Now, what a gentleman we have here! I sure will give her your note, if she comes back.”

She gave him a pen and a piece of paper so he could write his short message, and eventually, he walked out of the shop with a smile on his lips.

————————————————————————

You were walking in the early hours of the morning. The rising sun still shed red lights across the rooftops and the high skyscrapers. You were not to start working before lunchtime, the repetitions would start then. You had your whole morning free, and you intended to enjoy it. The weather, just like the day before, promised only sunshine and smiles.

Somehow, your feet guided you back to Central Park, and you walked before that flower shop again, the one in which you had bought your flowers the day before. It was not open yet, but you took a moment to look at the flowers inside anyway, glancing at the bright shades through the windows. And the sight brought a smile to your lips.

You were about to walk away when Carlotta stormed out of the shop.

“Ha! I knew it was you! You’re the girl from yesterday, who found the wallet!”

“Huh… yes?” you raised an eyebrow, perplexed.

“I gave the wallet back to his owner!”

“Great…”

“He left a note for you, hang on!”

“A note…?”

But before you could add another word, Carlotta had stormed inside the shop again, and only reappeared with a piece of paper in her hand.

You thanked her, taking the note and clumsily changing your weight from one foot to the other as you felt quite uncomfortable.

The handwriting was quite clear despite the obvious hurry it was written with.

Dear Stranger,

Thank you for returning my wallet, I was quite distraught when I realized I had lost it. Thank you as well for not stealing all the money that was inside, the florist seemed indeed to think it was an admirable act. Chivalry is most certainly still alive, at least, she seemed to think so.

I hope you have a nice day.

You smiled at the message, and the gesture only widened as Carlotta handed you a peony.

“He asked me to give you this too.”

“Well, thank you,” you mumbled, blushing hard.

“It’s him you should thank!”

“Well if you see him…”

“Oh, but you should write him a reply! Hang on, I’ll fetch you a pen and some paper!”

“You don’t have to bother…”

“Oh, but it makes me happy! The thought is romantic, don’t you think? Two strangers exchanging love letters in my flower shop…”

You laughed at her as she disappeared again, and came back with what you needed to write a message of your own.

Dear Stranger,

There is nothing to thank me for, it was only normal to give you back your wallet intact. Carlotta might be a little too romantic. After all, she already pictures us exchanging love letters through her hands. What a funny idea!

Have a nice day too, and don’t lose your wallet again this time! I might not be here to find it again for you.

You handed the florist the note, and she excitedly put it in her pocket.

“Do something for me, and come back here in a few days. Who knows… he may have replied by then.”

You laughed at her again, but there was something so excited and honest in her gaze, that you agreed. After all, it couldn’t hurt to drop by, right? It wasn’t like it would change your life…

 ******************************

Tag list : @ponycake27 @horsesreign @xinyourdreamsx @jbluevelvet @notkeppeki @daynigt-dreamer-stuff @fudgeflyss @stuckupstucky @snek-shit @suchatinyinfinity @i-padfootblack-things @theonelittleone

I allow myself to also tag : @madamrogers and @marvelcapsicle cause I know they will be interested…

It was not open yet, but you took a moment to look at the flowers inside anyway, glancing at the bright shades through the windows. And the sight brought a smile to your lips.

You were about to walk away when Carlotta stormed out of the shop.

“Ha! I knew it was you! You’re the girl from yesterday, who found the wallet!”

“Huh… yes?” you raised an eyebrow, perplexed.

“I gave the wallet back to his owner!”

“Great…”

“He left a note for you, hang on!”

“A note…?”

But before you could add another word, Carlotta had stormed inside the shop again, and only reappeared with a piece of paper in her hand.

You thanked her, taking the note and clumsily changing your weight from one foot to the other as you felt quite uncomfortable.

The handwriting was quite clear despite the obvious hurry it was written with.

Dear Stranger,

Thank you for returning my wallet, I was quite distraught when I realized I had lost it. Thank you as well for not stealing all the money that was inside, the florist seemed indeed to think it was an admirable act. Chivalry is most certainly still alive, at least, she seemed to think so.

I hope you have a nice day.

You smiled at the message, and the gesture only widened as Carlotta handed you a peony.

“He asked me to give you this too.”

“Well, thank you,” you mumbled, blushing hard.

“It’s him you should thank!”

“Well if you see him…”

“Oh, but you should write him a reply! Hang on, I’ll fetch you a pen and some paper!”

“You don’t have to bother…”

“Oh, but it makes me happy! The thought is romantic, don’t you think? Two strangers exchanging love letters in my flower shop…”

You laughed at her as she disappeared again, and came back with what you needed to write a message of your own.

Dear Stranger,

There is nothing to thank me for, it was only normal to give you back your wallet intact. Carlotta might be a little too romantic. After all, she already pictures us exchanging love letters through her hands. What a funny idea!

Have a nice day too, and don’t lose your wallet again this time! I might not be here to find it again for you.

You handed the florist the note, and she excitedly put it in her pocket.

“Do something for me, and come back here in a few days. Who knows… he may have replied by then.”

You laughed at her again, but there was something so excited and honest in her gaze, that you agreed. After all, it couldn’t hurt to drop by, right? It wasn’t like it would change your life…

[[MORE]]

New York in bloom was a fair sight to see. The streets were filled with merry strangers mingling with the always-hurrying workers. Unknown faces that kept on moving all around, in one direction or the other. And in the centre of the busy city, Central Park was an oasis lost in a desert.

Central Park was filled with laziness and sunshine. Children played while their parents relaxed under the shadow of the trees. And through the park, the flowers coloured the alleys and filled the air with sugary fragrances.

Everything felt sunny and happy to you. But perhaps it was also the prospect of starting a new job that made you this merry.

A three months job was awaiting you here in New York. The creation of a new movie was always exciting to you. It meant that you would bring a brand-new character to life. After all, it was the advantage of becoming an actress.

You would start this new job the next day, and you had to admit that your excitement was tainted with apprehension. It was always a strange mix of fear and excitement, to start a new adventure. And because this next movie was a love story, you were even more nervous than usual. After all, if you couldn’t get along with the actor playing your love interest, everything would be harder.

You counted on Chris Evans’s professionalism in any case. After all, he was talented and had a good reputation amongst actors. Everything would surely be just fine.

You crossed the street from the edge of the park to the busy sidewalks that ran against the skyscrapers. An old man was selling hot dogs, when a few meters away, you could buy today’s newspapers. There was a strange excitation all around you, a dance of shorts and dresses and briefcases and suits. A mix of holidays and busy workers. But most of all, it felt like New York. There was no other word to describe the peculiar atmosphere.

You had spotted from afar a little flower shop at the corner of the street, on the right side of the park. And with such a sun shining in the sky, you couldn’t refrain the urge to buy a bouquet for your apartment. Or well, your cousin’s apartment, actually. Edgar had accepted with a grin to welcome you in his flat for the three months you were to work in the busy city. You were thus living now with him… and almost with his boyfriend too, as Sebastian spent more time there than in his own flat.

And you reckoned that nor Edgar nor Seb would mind if you bought a few bright flowers.

You headed there with a content smile on your face, humming softly a song to yourself, your voice covered by the sounds of the street.

Cars honked a few meters away as you reached the door of the shop. Flowers were also sprayed outside, the bouquets narrowing the sidewalk, and you spent a few minutes admiring the plants. You smelled some of them, from gerberas to daisies and roses. Red, yellow, white, pink, orange… so many colours that widened the smile on your lips.

You chose a few gerberas and finally walked inside the shop, discovering flowers and plants everywhere, filling the room, resting on many shelves… so many that the stone walls were barely visible under so many petals and leaves.

You were admiring a red hibiscus when you spotted on the wooden floor what looked like a piece of leather. You picked it up and recognized the object as a wallet. Puzzled, you brought it to one of the employees, a tall woman with red hair whose name was pinned on her apron as Carlotta.

“Oh… dear! The poor man!” she exclaimed, looking around the shop, but there was no other client than you inside. “Well, give it to me, dear. I’ll make sure he gets it. Have you chosen some flowers? Oh, now… what a good choice! Gerberas are such happy flowers, I’ll make you a bouquet!”

As you walked out of the shop, you took a deep breath into the sweet scent of your flowers, closing your eyes to engrave the fragrance in your lungs, trying to remember it.

When you opened your eyes again, you let your gaze drift across the crowd… A woman pushing a stroller, a couple holding hands, a man running with his dog next to him and finally waiting at a traffic light…

Why would someone be rushing today?

After all, it was such a lovely day…

——————————————————————

These past couple of days had been hell.

Chris was near panicked. His stay at New York started beautifully…

He had missed his train to come from Boston, had almost killed a cat with a dishwasher (that adventure was probably the worst) and now he had lost his wallet.

Beautiful start indeed…

He was now running through the streets of New York, Dodger’s leash tightly held in his hand. And he found that the weather was way too hot for that…

Waiting for the lights to turn green at a crossroad, he took off his Patriots cap to dry his sweaty brow. By his side, Dodger seemed to have a good time running around the streets.

At least one of them had a good time…

His heart was beating fast, but Chris wasn’t sure if it was because of his running or because of the fear that made a lump creep up his throat.

He searched again for this flower shop he had stopped by a few hours before.

Where was that damn shop…? He remembered it was around there, but his brain seemed too numbed by stress and nerves to work properly.

By his side, Dodger barked a couple of times as the traffic light turned green and people started to hurry forward. As he crossed the road, he finally spotted the bright flowers in the distance.

He didn’t slow down his pace before he had reached the welcoming shop, and he did nothing less than run inside.

He hurried to Carlotta, who stood behind the counter, and he had to lean against the wooden surface as he caught his breath.

“Oh, hello again! I recognize you, you were here this morning already! Have you changed your mind and want to buy something?” Carlotta asked with a bright smile.

But Chris shook his head.

“I’ve lost my wallet this morning, so I’m tracing back my steps,” he explained, heaving a sigh to try to slow down his racing heart, his voice cut by his shallow breathing. “You wouldn’t have found it, by any chance?”

“Oh! But of course! You’re a lucky man! This lovely woman just found one near the hibiscus over there. Hang on, I’ll check the ID inside to see if it’s yours.”

“Oh, yes, please do,” Chris begged, leaning over the wooden counter while the florist walked in her office.

He rested his cheek against the cool surface, closing his tired eyes, breathing deeply to fill his lungs with as much air as he could, before letting it all out again. Slowly, he caught his breath and felt his heart reach a regular rhythm once more. He didn’t look up before Carlotta was back with the wallet, and he let out a grunt as he forced himself to stand straighter again.

He recognized his belonging in the blink of an eye, and he heaved a relieved sigh.

“Thank god…”

“It is yours indeed! You really are lucky, I hadn’t spotted it at all. It’s a client who did, and… oh actually you could have bumped into each other, she exited the shop a minute before you rushed in!”

“After such a fright, I’m glad it ended that way!” he grinned, resting a hand on his heart. “Actually… now that I’ve found my wallet back, I think I’ll buy these flowers I saw outside.”

“The peonies? That’s a very good choice, they’re particularly beautiful this year!”

Carlotta hurried outside to fetch some pink peonies, the shade pale and as delicate as the petals themselves. Meanwhile, Chris was petting Dodger with a bright laugh.

“Ends well, buddy! I didn’t think so at first!”

The dog merely swayed his tail and barked a couple of times in response, as if seeing Chris smiling was enough to make the pet understand that the day was not so bad after all.

As the florist came back with the flowers, she kept the conversation going.

“Such a lovely lady, it was… and an honest one! These days, many would have taken the money before handing over the rest.”

“Well, if she comes back, please, thank her for me.”

He paid for the flowers and turned around to leave, but he stopped dead in his tracks before even taking a step towards the door.

Dodger was already trotting towards the exit, pulling on his leash but Chris wasn’t moving. Instead, he spun back around towards Carlotta.

“Actually… if she comes back… would you mind giving her a note? I’d like to thank her myself and… give her a peony for me. I’ll buy you one more.”

Carlotta heaved a dreamy sigh.

“Now, what a gentleman we have here! I sure will give her your note, if she comes back.”

She gave him a pen and a piece of paper so he could write his short message, and eventually, he walked out of the shop with a smile on his lips.

————————————————————————

You were walking in the early hours of the morning. The rising sun still shed red lights across the rooftops and the high skyscrapers. You were not to start working before lunchtime, the repetitions would start then. You had your whole morning free, and you intended to enjoy it. The weather, just like the day before, promised only sunshine and smiles.

Somehow, your feet guided you back to Central Park, and you walked before that flower shop again, the one in which you had bought your flowers the day before. It was not open yet, but you took a moment to look at the flowers inside anyway, glancing at the bright shades through the windows. And the sight brought a smile to your lips.

You were about to walk away when Carlotta stormed out of the shop.

“Ha! I knew it was you! You’re the girl from yesterday, who found the wallet!”

“Huh… yes?” you raised an eyebrow, perplexed.

“I gave the wallet back to his owner!”

“Great…”

“He left a note for you, hang on!”

“A note…?”

But before you could add another word, Carlotta had stormed inside the shop again, and only reappeared with a piece of paper in her hand.

You thanked her, taking the note and clumsily changing your weight from one foot to the other as you felt quite uncomfortable.

The handwriting was quite clear despite the obvious hurry it was written with.

Dear Stranger,

Thank you for returning my wallet, I was quite distraught when I realized I had lost it. Thank you as well for not stealing all the money that was inside, the florist seemed indeed to think it was an admirable act. Chivalry is most certainly still alive, at least, she seemed to think so.

I hope you have a nice day.

You smiled at the message, and the gesture only widened as Carlotta handed you a peony.

“He asked me to give you this too.”

“Well, thank you,” you mumbled, blushing hard.

“It’s him you should thank!”

“Well if you see him…”

“Oh, but you should write him a reply! Hang on, I’ll fetch you a pen and some paper!”

“You don’t have to bother…”

“Oh, but it makes me happy! The thought is romantic, don’t you think? Two strangers exchanging love letters in my flower shop…”

You laughed at her as she disappeared again, and came back with what you needed to write a message of your own.

Dear Stranger,

There is nothing to thank me for, it was only normal to give you back your wallet intact. Carlotta might be a little too romantic. After all, she already pictures us exchanging love letters through her hands. What a funny idea!

Have a nice day too, and don’t lose your wallet again this time! I might not be here to find it again for you.

You handed the florist the note, and she excitedly put it in her pocket.

“Do something for me, and come back here in a few days. Who knows… he may have replied by then.”

You laughed at her again, but there was something so excited and honest in her gaze, that you agreed. After all, it couldn’t hurt to drop by, right? It wasn’t like it would change your life…

summary: Dating Johnny Storm/The Human Torch would include...
title: Dating Johnny Storm/The Human Torch would include...
body:
(Picture and gif above are not mine!!!! I just searched for a Picture and a gif of  Chris Evans Johnny Storm/Human Torch!!!!!)

  • Being part of the Fantastic 4 (Fantastic 5).
  • Being Ben’s younger sister.
  • Johnny flirting with you constantly and you constantly threatening him to make him stop.
  • You eventually developing a crush on him.
  • Him asking you on a date and you accepting (to his surprise).
  • Him taking you to see a movie and then dinner at your favorite restaurant.

Him being a gentleman the whole time. 
Him walking you to your room and kissing you on the cheek before walking away to his own room.

  • Him asking you to be his girlfriend on your 5th date after he kisses you under the moonlight.

You saying yes and kissing him again.
Him smiling against your lips while he twirls you around making you giggle against his lips.

  • Susan and Ben freaking out when you tell her that you and Johnny are dating.

You reassuring them that he won’t hurt you.

  • Slow kisses.
  • Make out sessions in empty hallways.
  • Neck kisses.
  • Forehead kisses.
  • Top of the head kisses.
  • Cheek kisses.
  • Him kissing your knuckles softly.
  • Him smirking and winking at you from across the room constantly making you blush.
  • Slow, passionate sex.
  • Rough sex.
  • Shower sex.
  • Him being very protective of you during battles.
  • Holding hands.
  • So many “I love you's” & “I love you too's”.
  • Him having an arm around your waist or shoulders.
  • Him getting jealous very easily.
  • Dr. Doom capturing you and Johnny rescuing you.
  • Him pulling you into a passionate kiss after a battle.
  • Him proposing to you after 4 years of dating (you obviously say yes).
  • Small wedding with just the rest of the Fantastic 4.
  • Honeymoon in Hawaii.

Tag list:

@lotus-eyedindiangoddess @snoozys

summary: HC: The reader teaching Chris Evans bachata and salsa.
question: HC: The reader teaching Chris Evans bachata and salsa.
answer:
Teaching Chris the Bachata and Salsa would include:

•Chris being so excited as he can’t wait to take you out dancing (and have a sensual dance session with you alone *wink wink)

•You loving his enthusiasm

•The two of you then pushing back the couch and table in the living room to create a mini dance floor

•You explaining the history of Bachata and Salsa while already having created a special playlist

•Chris intensely listening to you while he already starts imagining sensually dancing with you

•His eyes slowly scanning you from head to toe

•”Chris! Focus!” you scold while knowing what kind of thoughts are swirling in his mind

•”Okay, first I need to see how you move your hips. Show me something” you order while putting on Suavemente before focusing on Chris

•Chris swaying his hips to the rhythm

•You almost fainting at the fact that he has no rhythm and rusty hips

•”Ay dios mio” O-O

•Chris not liking the way you’re looking at him like

•You then having to teach the actor how to keep up to a song’s rhythm, you having to guide his hips with your hands

•Chris feeling disappointed as he knows that a lot of training is ahead of him

•The two of you then having daily training sessions

•Chris learning how to dance to the rhythm which leaves you relieved and hopeful to have a sensual salsa dance with him

•Him getting better and better, astonishing you

•The two of you then finally being able to dance to your favorite songs while you teach him the Bachata and Salsa

•Chris always holding you close and always surprising you by sensually grinding his hips against yours

•Him staring deeply into your eyes while his hands slowly start exploring your thick waist and luscious curves

•The dancing session always ending up with the two of you making rough, nasty or passionate love to one another
